ggplot map
```{r}
# Get a data frame with longitude, latitude, and size of bubbles (a bubble = a city)
nyc <- map_data("nyc")
gg  <- ggplot()
gg  <- gg + 
         geom_map(
           data=nyc, 
           map=nyc,
           aes(x=long, y=lat, map_id=region))
gg

data <- permits_sf_ny 

data <- data %>%
  arrange(ClassANet) %>%
  mutate( mytext=paste(
    "Year: ", PermitYear, "\n",
    "Council Member: ", council.member, "\n",
    "Net Housing: ", ClassANet, sep=""))

ggplot() +
    geom_polygon(data = nyc, aes(x=long, y = lat, group = group), fill="grey", alpha=0.3) +
    geom_point(aes(x=long, y=lat, size=ClassANet, color=PermitYear, text=mytext, alpha=0.5) ) +
    theme_void() +
    coord_map() +
    theme(legend.position = "none")

p <- ggplotly(p, tooltip="text")
p
```
